title.value: Learning Reliable Logical Rules with SATNet
title.justification: The title was explicitly stated on the first page and in the citation information.
title.quote: Learning Reliable Logical Rules with SATNet

extractions.description: This paper presents a novel framework that bridges logical reasoning and deep learning by generating interpretable and verifiable logical rules through differentiable learning without the need for pre-specified logical structures. The proposed methodology improves upon SATNet, a differentiable MaxSAT solver, by introducing a maximum equality specification method that decodes SATNet’s learned weights into human-readable logical rules. The framework also incorporates domain knowledge for enhanced reliability.

type.justification: The paper introduces new methods, theoretical insights, and a novel specification—a theoretical approach.
type.quote: We introduce a novel specification formulation called “maximum equality”, which transforms the learned matrix C into a weighted MaxSAT formula.

primary_research_field.justification: The field is explicitly mentioned in both the abstract and introduction, focusing on the integration of deep learning with logical reasoning.
primary_research_field.quote: Bridging logical reasoning and deep learning is crucial for advanced AI systems.

sub_research_fields.justification: The paper emphasizes interpreting and verifying logical rules derived from deep learning models, focusing on interpretability.
sub_research_fields.quote: We propose a novel specification method called 'maximum equality', which enables the interchangeability between the learned weights of SATNet and a set of propositional logical rules in weighted MaxSAT form.

name.justification: SATNet is the core model discussed throughout the paper and serves as the foundation for the proposed methods.
name.quote: A notable outcome in this field is SATNet [32], a differentiable MaxSAT solver based on a low-rank semidefinite programming (SDP) approach.

caracteristics.justification: The model is explicitly described as a differentiable MaxSAT solver.
caracteristics.quote: SATNet [32], a differentiable MaxSAT solver based on a low-rank semidefinite programming (SDP) approach.

name.justification: The dataset used for evaluating Sudoku puzzles is distinctly mentioned in the experiments.
name.quote: On the 4 × 4 Sudoku dataset, both SATNet and SATNet* exhibit remarkable performance, achieving testing accuracies of 99.89% and 99.90%.

name.justification: The dataset for stream transformations tasks like parity function and binary bit addition is mentioned in the experiments.
name.quote: Experiment setup. In this experiment, we evaluate our proposed framework on three stream transformation tasks, i.e., the parity function, binary bit addition, and symbol counting.

name.justification: The library Gurobi is used as an exact solver to replace SATNet during inference.
name.quote: With the decoded logical rules, we can employ an exact solver (e.g., Gurobi [13]) to replace SATNet during inference.
